intro: Plesioneuron myriosorum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other plants like cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Plesioneuron myriosorum is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
